content:
Yes, the introduction of the Dartford Low Emission Zone (LEZ) has had a positive impact on air quality in the area. The LEZ was introduced in 2014 to improve air quality by encouraging the use of cleaner vehicles that meet low emissions standards. Vehicles that do not meet the required emissions standards are subject to a daily charge to enter the zone.

According to data from the Dartford Borough Council, the introduction of the LEZ has resulted in a reduction of nitrogen dioxide (NO2) concentrations by an average of 15% in areas close to the zone. The council also notes that the number of vehicles registered in the lowest emissions categories has increased significantly since the introduction of the LEZ.

Additionally, the London Air Quality Network, which measures air pollution levels in the region, has recorded a decrease in NO2 and particulate matter (PM10) levels in the area since the introduction of the LEZ.

Overall, the Dartford LEZ has had a positive impact on air quality in the area, although further measures may be necessary to continue improving air quality and reducing the impact of traffic-related pollution.
